metatags.og:title: Russia’s Ill-Fated Invasion of Ukraine: Lessons in Modern Warfare
metatags.og:description: Russia failed to achieve its main political and military objectives in Ukraine because of poor military planning, significant logistical problems, low combat readiness, and other deficiencies. These challenges will be difficult for the Russian military to fix quickly.

metatags.og:description: Recent setbacks haven’t deterred Putin’s forces from advancing on the city of Bakhmut and claiming all of the mineral-rich Donbas region. President Biden told the CBS News program “60 Minutes” that any use of unconventional weapons would turn Russia into “more of a pariah” than it has ever been.

metatags.og:title: Commentary
metatags.og:description: Timely analysis is vital to achieving real policy impact in a rapidly evolving world. The Center for European Policy Analysis (CEPA) works with leading voices in government, business, civil society, and media to provide cutting-edge analysis of the most urgent transatlantic policy questions. Our work brings forward-thinking ideas, innovative policy recommendations, and key insights on trends across areas of transatlantic digital policy, defense technology, democratic resilience, and security and defense.
